review: This restaurant is consistently great & the service is top notch.  We were there on a busy Friday night.  The wait staff was constantly checking with us to apologize for our food being slow when it was understandable the kitchen was inundated with orders.  The manager gave us a free appetizer while we waited. At this restaurant customer service is a priority.

I've been here twice over the last six months. The one thing I certainly don't like about this place (and it probably goes for all locations I'm guessing) is they told us they don't take reservations. So for the first time I came here, we had a party of maybe 8-9, and since reservations weren't allowed, we had to wait a very long time to be seated because I guess whoever had a large party was just sitting there. I get it, after you eat and pay you wanna talk a little more, that's fine, I've done it before too. I think if a reservation option was available, we wouldn't have had to wait as long because we'd already have seats for us, instead of having to stand around hungry for longer than we expected. The more recent time I came here, the wait for a table of about the same size was about ten minutes or less!  I don't have any problems with the servers here (both times they've been just fine) and the food here is fine (not my favorite, but there's decent stuff here) I was just very turned off with the no reservations thing.

Pros:  The food is good, there a a lot of different burgers and things to pick, plus bottomless french fries.  The drinks are also yummy.  It is worth the money you pay, plus if it is your birthday you get free ice cream. The customer service is pretty good, although it is a bit slow because of how crowded it is, they will bring you free fries if you ask.  Cons:  It is LOUD.  There are a lot of kids, birthdays, and long lines if you go at the wrong time.   A good place to go every once and awhile for a nice meal, as long as you don't mind the crowds and the wait.  Not the best place for a date night.

Enjoyed a very decent burger here recently and my friends chicken sandwich was rated as average by him. Maybe my expectations were set to high for maybe I was thinking there were going to be some new exciting menu items but it was rather predictable. Don't get me wrong it was a good burger just wasn't one that would make me drive out of my way too far to try again. If I am in the area and hungry I would be back for sure it's just not a destination spot.

They've got such a nice staff - and even though I'm not the biggest fan of their food (it was served cold last time I came!), I still like the atmosphere and the prices are semi-reasonable.  I order the fries well done because I prefer crispiness :D   And aside from my food being cold the last visit, they had spilled sauce along the lining of my basket and it had gotten on my shirt.  The waiter was so quick to get me club soda which I was really impressed with.  He didn't just leave it at "oh I'm sorry here are some extra napkins".  Thanks!

We were here on July 31st, 2012 & spent $40.08 on lunch.  The kids like eating here.   Tayler was our server.  She looked tired and overworked.  She rarely smiled and had her head down most of the time we were eating there.  Its very difficult to give this place anything past a 3rd star....

We go to this Red Robin weekly and sometimes multiple times a week.  Although it is the worst Red Robin we go to - it is the most convenient one near our house.  They mess up our food about 25% of the time we go here - it always seems to be a problem with the cooks/kitchen.  Once I ordered a BBQ chicken wrap - after the first bite I knew something was different but didn't figure it out until I was halfway done - IT DIDNT HAVE ANY BBQ SAUCE IN IT!  Seems odd to leave out the BBQ Sauce in a BBQ Chicken Wrap.  I told the waitress who just said "oh I will go get you some"  she arrived with a small cup of the barbecue sauce that I had to disassemble the wrap and apply myself - we didn't get any credit for the meal.  This is only one of the typical things that go wrong.  Since we go here enough we know that we should never order a cocktail unless we see a Bartender on duty - leaving this up to the general servers will always result in a bad drink.   Always make sure they give you napkins before you bit into your juicy burger and have it dripping down your hand - about half the time they forget to give us napkins or utensils with salads.  We have found that in the past 6 months they have some new staff that really make a difference.   The guy running the bar most days makes great drinks and is fun to talk to.  They have some servers too that seem to be more friendly and knowledgeable than the ones in the past.  They also extended the bar area (which in the past only included 2 person tables - which was horrible for happy hour if you had a group of more than 2) - now the bar booths can accommodate groups up to 6.  I am happy to see the Woodinville Red Robin improving and hope it continues into the kitchen.

This is the best Red Robin i've been to. i've had a good experience every time i go to this location and keeps on getting better. the waiting times are fairly short. i've been here twice and both were fun times. one time i went to see The Amazing Spiderman in the theaters with some friends and came here when it was over. it was on the night that there was the midnight showing of the debut of the latest batman movie and the wait wasn't long. we were a group of 6 and decided to squeeze into a booth our desserts arrived shortly, even though there was a group of 50 people there. my most recent visit was on my mom's birthday when i was with my grandparents. we waited less than 10 minutes before we were seated into a booth. We got the best waiter we've ever had (named Jordan) and he's worked there since 2006.  He was very good and not as pushy as other servers. my food was very good. My burger wasn't piping hot, but that's the way i like it. the fries seemed underseasoned, but that's why they have the seasoned salt and ketchup on the tables the bottomless steak fries are one of the main reasons i love red robin so much. Most restaurants charge you for fries, and they aren't bottomless. Why i love Red Robin (especially this location) so much good portion sizes for the money bottomless steak fries that come with the meal irresistably good burgers (my faves are Burnin' Love and Banzai amazing service and their rewards program
Brandon our server was great. Gave my daughter a ton of baby oranges her favorite. Good food yum!...  I always love the food and although they were super busy our server took time to make us happy.

I've always loved RR, with rare exception. The one in Woodinville is very well managed. The food is always great when I've gone here, as are the drinks. If you want the best waiter ever, ask for Ryan. He's the waiter equivalent to a rockstar!

As far as Red Robins go, this is definitely one of the better ones. The food is always good and the staff is always friendly. Great place to go for a burger and fries and a pint. It's a chain so you're going to get the cheesy decor, big menus, and foo foo drinks, but if you can get over that, the food is pretty good and the prices aren't terrible. We try to go during happy hour and grab a table in the bar. It's not a great happy hour but at least you can save a couple of bucks on your beer. I usually skip the appetizers because they're kind of gutbombs but there's one or two that aren't terrible if you're in the mood.

Obviously a chain restaurant and you pretty much get what you expect here. It's worthy of a review only because of the customer service here -- which is surprisingly.... tolerant!  I was really surprised at just how crowded this location was when we stepped in (our original lunch option was closed and this was our back-up option). Perhaps because so many other places nearby are a bit more pricey (thinking of Big Fish Grill, Teddy's Bigger Burgers, etc.) more people flock to RR. Whatever the reason, it definitely was crowded with a wait at the door and a rather packed restaurant! Our dining experience was as expected with no problems or issues. The staff seemed very friendly despite dealing with various issues that were popping up around us though. At a nearby table one customer was just complaining constantly and management came to discuss the problem with them and they were so patient and even able to maintain their composure for something that seemed rather trivial to us at our table. The customer with the complaint wouldn't calm down, but the staff at RR handled it beautifully. This RR definitely does a good job with their staff from the greeters to waiters all the way up to their management. They also stay true to what is expected of the RR experience. Well done.

As Red Robins go, this one is very good.  Clean decor, good service, consistent food quality.  This one has an outdoor patio, and of course a bar (where you may also dine) with lots of color TVs. Last visit here 12/31 was typically good, our server kept drinks filled and checked in often enough. Value: Prices here are a little higher than I would like.  You're usually looking at $15-20/person. GREEN Rating - Red Robin has an active 'green stewardship' within the corporation, which I appreciate - I spotted earth friendly takeout materials, and of course instore dining is all reuseable serviceware.

I've been going to Red Robins since I was a little girl! Therefore I have been to many different Red Robin franchises. I moved to Woodinville less than two years ago, so this became the Red Robin of choice if we ever wanted Red Robin. It is probably the dirtiest Red Robin I have ever been in. The floors and the molding along the floor and the wall has quite the buildup of dirt. Gross. I always have to wipe my booth off before siting down unless I want to sit on the person's food from before me.  Other than this, the food was always the same as the other Red Robins, which is a good thing. Until.....I ordered my 10month old a side of their mandarin oranges (like .90 cents) and as I am feeding her, there is cheddar cheese mixed throughout the oranges. Sick. Obviously I flagged the waitress down and told her. She asked us if she could get us more and I said no thanks and she was about to walk away with out even removing the dish from our table. I actually had to say wait and hand it to her. Then she shows up a bit later with a new dish of oranges...even though we said no. Whatever. We get the bill and needless to say the oranges are still on the bill. I know its just .90 cents but come one, it's the principle of the matter! I asked her to remove it from our bill and she yelled across the room to the manager to ask him to take it off. Terrible service.  The very next time we come back, maybe about a month later, I order a diet coke and after drinking about half of it there is something in my glass!! I fish it out with my straw and it is a DIRTY STRING. Wow. Asked for the manager and her exact words were "I am sorry, there is not much more I can do than say I am sorry." Are you kidding me!? My husband and I just stared at each other like wtf. How about comp our bill? Or maybe, just maybe, take the diet coke off.... I worked as a host, server and manager in the restaurant business when I was younger. I know good service and good management. This place has neither...not even a good bus boy. (Can't wipe down the seat?) But that all lands on the management...it is their responsibility to teach their employees good service.

Last night dinner @ Red Robin Woodinville...  YUCK!  Cold Soggy Fish sandwich and cold fries!!! My wife and I went out for a fish sandwich, salad, and onion rings...  Here's the chronology... NCAA tournament is on, time was around 8 PM.  Restaurant was fairly busy, but we were seated right away.   Server apologized for the delay (he was busy) - we understood :) Ordered drinks and our Onion rings and asked for them to be served first before our meal.  At the same time we also ordered a fish sandwich, salad, and fries.  We asked for the fish sandwich order to be put in after the o-rings so we could enjoy a hot meal. The o-rings came out cold, we requested replacement.  The server took them back and the "manager" stopped by and apologized and gave us replacement rings.  Hot this time - they also removed them from our bill.  That was nice. 10 minutes later our fish sandwich arrived with fries and a side salad.  The fish was COLD and soggy, the fries were cold...  They were delivered by another server.  We asked for refills on our water...  No water refills came... After already raising a concern about the cold onion rings...  We looked and the manager was busy talking with his staff in the bar and in the back.  He was nowhere in sight to greet customers, or to follow-up. Disappointed...  We ended up eating a cold soggy fish sandwich with cold fries with a salad.  Several minutes later our server stopped by - we again asked for waters, he did return with refills.  Clearly he was "busy", but that is expected at RR...  It did not seem like he was any busier than a typical evening at RR. Sadly, although we enjoy RR fries and food, we will not be returning to this RR...
Red Robin is always A-OK... Good place to eat casual food.  Its a chain, so don't expect it to be AWESOME!! lol

Okay, I just have to leave a review for this RR, and mostly because our Server, Ashley was fan-effing-tastic!  We came in on Easter Sunday while running an errand in Woodinville. First off, props to all the suckers who either volunteered for working or didn't get a choice. It was a gorgeous day, like the first 70 degree day of the year, so everybody wanted to sit outside. (and by everybody means like 10 tables.. it wasn't crowded, but crowded enough that it was a lot of tables for one person). Ashley seriously stepped it up. She was bubbly, friendly, very attentive and super nice. She was on top of her game, especially for it being hot out and she was the only one out there. I'm pretty sure she also mentioned she was preggo. She brought out fries for us to snack on before our burgers without us even having to ask. She constantly refilled our beverages. When I told her I had an allergy she made extra notes to have them cook it on a separate surface! I didn't even know RR did that. Nobody else has ever offered that when I say I'm extremely allergic to gluten..My order came out wrong and she noticed before she even sat it on the table. She brought me more fries while I waited for a replacement, and took it off my tab for the inconvenience.  She made our experience ultra enjoyable. Thank you!! (The food was okay, too) Even if it took 2 tries.

I would rate it one star, but that wasn't an option. I generally enjoy my visits here. It's been my guilty pleasure until today. I waked in the door and there was no one there to greet or seat me. I stood for several minutes as no less than 7 employees, including the manager walked by and looked directly at me without even a nod or a hello. It wasn't until two more guests arrived and were standing nearby that the manager finally said "three?". The latter two told him I was first and he waled over to a table and dropped a menu there for me and went back to seat the others. A nice server came by and gor my drink order. He left my drink and went on his way. After sitting a few more minutes, I'd had it. I left.  The place wasn't even busy. I won't return to this location anytime soon.

I love me some Red Robin but this evening I had a pretty lame dinner.  Food was ok,Greasy onion ring tower, fryer wasn't hot enough.  But the food wasn't the problem.  It was the service.  No silverware, had to ask for it.  No appetizer plates for the onion ring appetizer, so we just made the table top a greasy mess.  For all the staff they have there I never felt really taken care of to the regular standards I've come to expect from RR generally. Not going to head back to this location again.
Busy every time I have gone but always great service! Love them

We have been to this place a few times now, and never have we received very good service. I don't know if it is the time of night we go in (9:00pm), or if the service is truly just that bad. Each time we have been in, there has been no one to seat us. Employees literally look at us and than look around and hope someone else will appear. After a while we are eventually seated, last time we nearly walked out. Two of the three times our waitresses/waiters have been very poor. Forgetting sauces, bring appetizers without plates, never returning so we can ask for plates, we even waited ten minutes for waters at one point. When the food does arrive we are not often impressed, the burgers have been overcooked, they forget your substitutes or put cheese on something when you ask for none. At first we were thinking maybe they were fluke experiences, but after the third time when our waitress thought it was more important to flirt with a coworker then check on us or pick up our bill, it became very clear that the people who run this Red Robin just do not care about their guest. Now we drive to Bothell or Redmond when we decide to go to Red Robin!

I was not really impressed with this Red Robin.  Not only did it take forever for the food to get to us, but when I got my cheese sticks and onion rings they were cold.  They made it right, but after it already took forever for the food to get to us, it wasn't fun to have to wait even longer.  Our server barely made it to our table, leaving us without drink refills and waiting forever (again) to get our check.  A dinner that should've lasted around 45 minutes took at least twice that long.

I used to work here so I can promise you that the food is gonna be great! I cant think of a single cook that was there that I didnt want cooking my meal. They are super stingy on hygiene so you know everything is gonna be clean and your food will be safe. Most of the servers there are good friends of mine and do great work. If you have a bad server, ask for a different server next time. There arent too many bad servers but it is kind of unavoidable to hire one once in a while in such a big company. Solid red robin location!

Went there because it was close and was starving!  Sat in the bar to get away from all the families in the main area.  The bartender was Sarah and she was great and got me my drink and food amazingly fast. I asked for a variation of one of their regular burgers and she was so nice to change it to what I wanted.   This place was really busy and yet the service and food was fantastic.   I only give it a 4 because it is kind of noisy.   I would recommend it to anyone in a hurry and very hungry! S

I used to eat at Red a Robin regularly and then I went for lunch and found the biggest grossest black hair in my food (@Bellevue location).  I was finally willing to try it again and now I think I am done with them.  The fries were cold and the new plastic plates appeared to have a greasy film all around the edge.  Quality is way down!
I used to hate Red Robin...and now I can't get enough. I think it's the sweet potato fries that change my mind. So good and did I mention yet BOTTOMLESS?!?!?

Yeah, it's a chain, but this one is good. I've eaten my share of Red Robin. They're all over the Puget Sound. I never got to eat at the original one (next to the bridge down by Fremont) but I've eaten in most all of the others from Marysville south to Federal Way. This one is good. Newly decorated, busy, with an airplane theme. Service is brisk and prompt, menu is impossible to read with the dim lights (use your cellphone flashlight). Drinks are large and easily replenished.  The real kicker - I ordered my food, it came out different than I ordered (they were busy). The MANAGER came and asked how it was, took my order back and I had a replacement plate within five minutes (plus a whole new batch of fries).  Plus they have a revolving door at the front which really makes a difference when it is cold and wet outside (meaning almost always). If you want to do chain burgers, sandwiches, and drinks, do it here. =;^)
Revolving doors are cool!! Not the fanciest of Red Robin locations but good food and service none the less. Full bar and attentive servers. No complaints here!
Good burgers, plenty of choices. Unlimited fries. Sweet potato fries also available. Large bar. Very noisy.

Amazing service for such a large chain!  My family came in yesterday and it was incredibly busy. My mom was in a bad mood because she had to cancel her birthday party,  and my dad was sick. Even so, after we were seated our server, Scott, was incredibly friendly and helpful. I even got to substitute fries for mac and cheese! We got all of our food on time and even got an extra order of sweet potato fries to go!!! Mad props to Scott. It's always worth it to go here.

Had dinner here a few weeks ago with my family after the movies. Our server was awesome! I've only been to The Everett location and not once have I ever had a good experience. It's about a 10 minute drive from my home to the Everett location and a 25 minute drive to the Woodinville location. I'll do the drive to Woodinville for the great service!! Thank you Woodinville Team!!!
This is the only Red robin I visit. Amazingly consistent food, never had to send back food. They have always got my order right. Do try their 'campfire' sauce with the fries, they are to die for!
I love Red Robin. Their burgers are always so good and I love the bottomless fries. This is an older red robin and kinda small but the food is still really good.

Awesome service from Alicia! Was is very delicious, would recommend to anyone.  At busy days it does take a while before you're seated but it's well worth the wait! Have never had a problem with anything at this location, I have had okay experiences at other red robins but this one is the best in the area!

I've been coming to Red Robin for ages.  I have been at locations all over Washington, from Olympia to Bellingham but this is the first time I have felt compelled to write a review.  This is based solely on the fact that we have had the same fantastic server twice in a row: Jack at the Woodinville Red Robin.  He is incredible!  Jack is personable, attentive, and he remembered us from when we came in last month.  Now let me say that over the years that I have been coming to Red Robin the food has been good, consistent from visit to visit, and served in a timely manner - you know, typical of a large chain restaurant.  But the distinguishing factor lately has been the service and I definitely want to come back soon.
I'm glad I used a gift card for my to go order because they hardly included any fries compared to when I eat there.
Late nights,  great place to crash in for late night food. Wish they would stay open till 11 like they used to! Still, they seem to keep a good staff on and it's great service w good value.
Great friendly service - had Megan twice and she's top notch. Very tasty food as well

service at the front of house was amazing. I sat in the bar. my order and drink were taken right away. then they placed my order and it took about 15 min to get, maybe more. the 8minute gift of time is a joke to the kitchen in Woodinville.  really it takes 6min to cook my chicken fillet and 1 min 15 sec for bun...why did my order take 16 min? my food runner grabbed it as soon as the kitchen threw it in the window. this red robin has a perfect FoH staff, but their kitchen is mediocre and sloppy. my burger did not look to standard, it took almost twice the amount of time. thank the foh for being so good otherwise I wouldn't come back.  PS my fries were not cooked to the allotted cooking time. they were pulled early and hot but not crunchy at all. I didn't even want a refill they were done so piss poorly. the kitchen staff really needs to try harder. they are bringing the rest of the place down.

I mean, it's Red Robin, ya know? It's always freaking loud and crowded at these restaurants. There's no avoiding that. So if you're looking for a place to sit down and have a quiet evening, Red Robin isn't the place for you. Especially when these soccer moms roll in with 12 plus kids for some birthday party. The food isn't bad. The wait staff is pretty friendly and nice. It's Red Robin, ya know?
Just like any other R.R. but the service was a little better from my memory.  I rarely waited for a table or my food.

The servers were quick and friendly, and the food tasted like any other Red Robin. However, the noise level was extremely high even though we arrived at a strange time (8 pm). Overall, the staff is helpful and efficient. This location has a close (and large) parking lot, which makes it easy to stop in and sit down to eat.

My team and I came to red robin to have a celebratory meal got there at 12:15pm. We finally ordered at 12:26pm at 1pm one of us went up to see where our food was and the manager Gary  said .... it hasn't been and hour your food is on its way and a very rude manner. Then when he finally brought the food to the table it was not what we ordered and then when we said something about the wait time the manager Gary gave us huge attitude and said " I know you guys are just hungry and here is your food "  Serena was the waitress that was very dry and not personable ... This manager needs to train better and know not to argue with customers... Here is pics of how food came back

We were lured here by the "Red Tavern" burger ad which touted a double patty for $6.99. The ad goes on to state "eat it like you stole it". What the ad neglects to mention (even in the fine print), was that each part is 2.2 ounces (pre-cooked weight).  To put this into perspective, both patties combined equal roughly the same as a McDonald's Quarter Pounder! Not such a steal after all! At least the fries are bottomless...
Service was exceedingly poor. Fries were raw. Kid's corn dog was also raw. In spite of telling the staff, we did not receive a credit or refund. Really, just a bad experience from start to finish.
I typically stop in to the bar. The wait staff are friendly, beers are super cold, and the food is tasty.

Red Robin is a place we frequent because we have young kids & because my husband has fond memories of going there as a kid himself. This location is such a hit and miss in regards to service. The last time we stopped in, we were very well taken care of by Chris, but on the two previous visits were largely ignored by the servers.  The food is pretty standard. The kids menu features the usual suspects of burgers, nuggets, and bottomless mac & cheese of the Kraft variety, which my kids love.  The adult menu has a good selection of burgers & sandwiches. I had a side of mac & cheese and was not impressed with what appeared to be buttered noodles mixed with cheddar cheese. The kid's mac was much better than the grown up version. It's a noisy family spot, so definitely don't plan on any long drawn out conversations. Do plan on a wait if you show up at the dinner rush.

I think the management at this location is very very good because the workers are always on their toes, and polite, and you can just basically tell that they are all being held to high standards. I do feel like service can be a bit slow at times. I don't understand why they don't have more servers during the crazy dinner rush that seems to happen every night. Maybe they are greedy and don't want to pay more workers? I feel like it is cruel to expect one server to wait on so many tables at once because our brains aren't meant to do so much multitasking and remembering. By the way the food is amazing

The Red Robin in Woodinville is one of the best Red Robin's I have ever been to. Way better than the one in Bothell/Canyon Park. Not only is the layout of the restaurant large enough to fit a lot of people, but also there is a long stretch of tables that can fit about forty people. The food is always excellent, and I've never had a problem with the quality of the food. If there were one meal I would recommend, it would be the Royal Burger, with a Dr. Pepper. Also, I have to mention Chelsea. Whenever I go with a group of twenty or more people, we always ask for her. She not only is helpful, hard working, and funny, but she is also very happy to see us every time we walk in the door. I cannot recommend this Woodinville location hard enough, and if you're ever in the area, stop by! And be sure to ask for Chelsea.

Love this place!! My friends and I come here once a week and the service is always great. We love the staff. Shout out to Serena! She always remembers iur orders down to the little details. Last Friday week got out of Church a little late and decided to go anyways thinking that they closed at midnight. This location closes at 11 p.m. however. They served us anyways even though we walked in the doors at 10:45. They were so sweet and accommodating and didn't seem bothered at all. There was 15 of us that night and they didn't rush us even a little. This is just one of the many reasons we continue to go to this location. We love you, Red Robin family!! If you serve it, we will come.

This is my husband and my favorite place to go in woodinville. Easy place to grab a beer or two. We went there last night and were a little disappointed. A bunch of the employees off duty crowded at 2 booths next to us in the bar. They were loud and rowdy. The part that grossed me out though was that they walked behind the bar to grab their own drinks and into the kitchen to grab their own food. All in their street clothes. Might I add that some of them didn't look very clean and presentable.

Good and bad, but mostly good. Consistency is the hallmark of any great restaurant, chain or otherwise. This particular Red Robin matches the level of quality in food, decor, service, and cleanliness of nearly every other Red Robin I've ever been to in the past 20+ years. What I particularly like about this location is the bar area. By no means the largest or fanciest Red Robin bar I've ever been in, it does the requisite job of filtering out the kids. So while there's plenty of screaming toddlers and birthday singing in the main restaurant, the bar mostly remains sedate even when popular sports are up on the many TVs.
The food at the Woodinville Red Robin is very good, though it is mostly hamburgers and such.  The service in the bar is excellent.

My dad and I went here for dinner after a work out so we were very hungry. We got escorted to our table by a very very grumpy greeter..but wait there's more! The floor was very slippery so my dad and I had to walk slowly and carefully so wouldn't slip and crack our heads open. As we got seated, it took awhile for the waitress to come but she was very happy and cheery, which made up for the wait. We ordered our food and drinks. She brought our drinks immediately, which pleased me. The food took forever, it may have felt longer cause we were starving, but trust me.. it was a wait! It did make me a little irritated when others got their food when they came in way after us. As soon as the food got to our table, my hot wings were cold! My mac n cheese was delicious, but still.. my hot wings were cold. My dad loved his dinner. He got a salad and a bunless burger. The only reason I gave this joint 2 stars is because the waitress was one of the best waitresses I've got served by! Other than that, I'm not sure if I'll be coming back again.

Proper Name: The Dirty Bird 1. Would be weird if you got beligerantly drunk there, and I have.   2. Say its bae's birthday when it's not.  3. Bottomless fries, test that.  4. If you're rude, remember, they're all in high school, go easy.  5. Best place to break up with bae in Woodinville.  Real Talk When I used to work there in high school they kept empty kegs by the dumpsters, still don't know why I haven't stolen one yet.  End Result Never forget to tell them it's your birthday.  Rating  Banzai Burger Smart

Had a horrible experience, went in asked for a table of two. Waited 15 minutes to be seated waited about 5 minutes to place our order then she left we noticed the time it was 9:30 at 10:00 the table next to us got all their food and they were seated at 9:40. Then at 10:15 our server told us we were on a red flag because something happened to our order? But we were high priority now. The whole place wasn't busy at all and there was 10 employees standing back there. I really can't bring myself to go back to a place that treats customers like they dont matter. It would have just been better to be honest and let us know instead of having us sit there for and wait. After ten more minutes we decided to leave as we were walking out we noticed there was no one to say anything to and they didn't even notice we were leaving? Wont go back to any red robin
I've been here a total of three times, everytime we are either not greeted or customer service is extremely poor. Compare to other red robin locations this one is the worst.

So much for "family friendly." I've been to this location a handful of times and have consistently been underwhelmed with the cleanliness and service, but we decided to give it a shot again because we thought it would be a good family spot to take our near 2-year-old (first time we've gone there with her).  Bad call.  Let me start by pointing out we were there before 5 p.m., so it wasn't busy at all. The waitress was nice enough, but never once came back to check on us. And that was a big problem for several reasons. 1.) My wife didn't get the sweet potato fries she ordered (still got charged the $1.50) 2.) Our toddler dropped her spoon. I tracked down another waiter who reluctantly offered to help. When he entered the kitchen I overheard him say, in a condescending tone , "I love babies." 3.) No drink or fry refills were offered until well after we'd finished our meals. 4.) When we spoke to the manager, he asked if we wanted anything (free dessert). We aren't the kind of people who complain to get free stuff, so we declined. All we asked for was our bill. That took another 10-15 minutes to show. Obviously, the "give an eff" level starts with management. We won't be returning.

Horrible service. Almost no one but Us In the restaurant yet the waitress didn't get us our drinks until our food came and when our food did come is was wrong. Once we got our drinks she refused to refill them. Horrible horrible service.

We were having an awesome day until we came here today.  Once we got sat, we ordered fries to come out first because we had a 1 and 2 year old with us and 2 appetizers and 3 drinks. The server messed up my moms drink because he put in a different drink then what she pointed to in a photo. Which is ok- mistakes happen.  But the manager walked up to us and said very rudely "was there a problem with your drink? Did you not like it or something?" My mom replied with "the server messed up my order. I'd like a different drink." And he didn't say anything and walked away. WOW, if that's not horrible service I'm not sure what is.  On top of that we waited about 20 mins after we sat for drinks and 40 for our appetizers (they forgot the sauce for the wings) and the fries came out with the apps.  Which is way too long for a half empty restraunt.  Needless to say, we won't be back. It's obvious the kitchen and servers don't have a good relationship and management is very poor at this location.

The bussing service is so bad that they seat people at dirty tables. It also took over 45 min for our food to come and only half the restaurant was filled. Even when the food came it was cold and not prepared properly. The manger was not really nice either. Would not come again.

I have always love the Cobb Salad but today when I ordered it for lunch the size has been cut to 1/4 of what it used to be and I was actually hungry when I left. Of course they didn't change the price. $15.09 for a Cobb Salad and Iced Tea.  Will not be going there again

Visited on a Saturday night around 6:30pm.  It was busy, but for two, they were able to seat me and my daughter in less than ten minutes.  Once we were seated, our waiter came over and took our drink and dinner order.  He was very warm and welcoming.  And this is where our experience goes South ... After waiting for 40 minutes, our waiter came by our table and said he'd check on our order as it still hadn't arrived.  Once he checked, our meals arrived.  Cold.  Without eating utensils or napkins.  And I had emptied my drink.  I flagged down another waiter, and asked if she could please give us some napkins and eating utensils and a drink refill.  Twenty minutes later, another server stops by our table and says another server asked the manager to drop off our requests, but he was busy and so was the original server so now he's dropping them off (what?!?).  We then ate our now legitimately cold meals (sans refills).  The manager stopped by to say "sorry, but your waiter has a large party to tend to" (because that's a legitimate reason to ignore our table of two apparently).  Another fifteen minutes pass by and our waiter comes by and says he's so sorry, but he had a big party to tend to (yes, really) and just forgot about us and the utensils and refills, etc, etc.  At this point, we ask for the check and leave.  I have never had such ridiculously poor service at a Red Robin.  The Redmond and Issaquah locations are always on top of everything - whether it's a table of two of twenty.  With that said, I am never coming back to this location.

The thing about Red Robin is that you know what you're going to get. Or at least you know what to expect. You can expect a great selection of delicious burgers and and ever-changing menu as they try to keep the options exciting and bring new tastes to us. So really, it comes down to the service which makes or breaks each location. Overall we had a good experience at this location. There were 5 adults and 3 kids - all under 5. We were seated with ample room for all of us (kids require bringing so much 'stuff' along with you) and everyone, including our server, was friendly and helpful. The one complaint I have is that our server mostly sensitive the fact that we had kids. She brought us the crayons and stuff for them and even took their orders first (good to get in right away). However there was a lag between when she took their orders and then came back for ours, which means the kids get and finish their meals well before the adults are remotely done. It ended up working out OK as we continued to stuff our kids full of fries while we finished our meals (kind kidding) but would be something to bring up in training about how to best meet the needs of families with young kids. Sheesh I sound like a whiney parent here! But really though, overall it was a good experience.

I would give 5 stars but my all time favorite Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad has left the menu!! So sad! Aside from things being taken off of the menu regularly that are sooooo addicting, Red Robin is great :) There is always room in the bar, everything gets out at a reasonable time. Super friendly staff :) The Baileys milkshake is exceptional ! One of my fav places to go!

I am done coming to this location. I have been going of at least once a month for the past 3 years. And came in on my birthday today and one of the waiters ask for my Id which expires on my 25th birthday at 12 pm. And I was asked to leave the bar because of this. I asked to talk to the manager and gave him what the law was for expired lisence. And he processed to tell me I was wrong.  Totally offended. And done.

Was a tad disappointed when I opened my food and the sauce I asked for wasn't there. To top it off there weren't fries in my box this is a first after all the times I've been here. I didn't even eat my burger was to upset. It won't be going back to this location again....
Berger was great and the waitress was super friendly. Fries are amazing and endless and did it all on lunch break.
Dirty. Slow service. Could use a visit from the owner. This place needs to be closed for a day and cleaned.

This used to be a fun place for our family to come, but it has changed, and not in a good way.  This was our go-to place to take the kids for a fun treat. They would beg to go. We were fine with that since we could grab a beer and alter the food to fit our preferences. The serving staff was typically attentive and gracious, and would engage with the boys. The server we had yesterday was lovely and did nothing that contributed to our poor experience. She was great. It was the overall atmosphere that really sealed the determination that we will not be back.  Three of our four orders came to us wrong. My older son noticed that his chicken strips were smaller than they used to be and there were only 2 rather than the 3 pictured in his menu. My younger son ordered a corn dog, as he always does; rather than 1 regular sized corn dog, he got a number of what seemed to be Vienna sausages dipped in corn batter, eww! My husband ordered the royal red robin burger with an extra patty, extra pickles, and no bun; the egg looked scorched and there were hardly any pickles. I ordered my guacamole bacon burger lettuce wrapped, and it arrived with no bun or wrap; no big deal there, but annoying.  They also seem to be slowly lessoning the wait staff, as each table now has a ridiculous screen for ordering appetizers, reordering drinks, and playing games and such. You also use it to pay your bill. It added a cold air of detachment to the experience, as if they can no longer be bothered to check on tables as frequently as before, although our server did make us a priority.  After the meal, we let the boys spend a few quarters in the game area, which was sad. The machines are obviously not being replenished, and I'm sure will be removed at some point in the near future, as Red Robin is moving toward an atmosphere of the sports bar and grill (of which there are already plenty and better establishments). When we got to the car, we realized our little guy had left his play glasses in the both, so I went back in for them. The hostess made a show to find them, but came back saying they weren't there. I had to tell 2 other people about them before they were finally found by someone who could be bothered to actually look.  Don't bother patronizing this or any Red Robin. There are better places for a burger; in Woodinville there are much better places for a beer, and families should definitely pass, as they obviously no longer want kids here (which I find silly as kids are future patrons themselves).
We were told a 25 minute wait, but it ended up being 15 minutes. The server was awesome, even when he was busy, we were able to receive everything on time! :)

my sister and i came in night before last with her two small children....the manager was helping seat the tables however she was not friendly. as we were sitting down she was yelling over to a server three tables away telling him she was going to double seat him. their conversation was very loud and should have taken place in a side station or something...then the manager lady came back to our table and said "can i get you some drinks your waitress is over there somewhere"...then the food took a very LONG time to come out especailly being it was a salad, a cold sandwhich and two kids mac n cheese. the kids were getting fussy so she brought out the two mac n cheese and my sisters salad. i waited 10 more minutes for my btla after asking two people for it, the fries were old and cold but i didnt want to send it back being that the kids were already finished and they were waiting on me being mine came out so much later....i know restaurants have off nights but this was bad.

On 31-Jul-2015, we stepped into an empty lobby ... where the hostess didn't approach or acknowledge us, and we only recognized her as an employee because the asst. manager walked by in the same uniform. We were seated (by default without asking) in the packed bar @ 11am, even with the main restaurant nearly empty (but we went along with it anyways), and I forgot I hate the bar area because the tables reek of mildew. Luckily our table also had a great view of the server/drink station's cabinet door hanging ajar by only 1 hinge. Our server immediately didn't believe my wife was deserving of her birthday month free burger (via their rewards program), even though she brought a printout, and he wouldn't honor it until she produced either her email address or cell-phone number to look her up. My 'Terminator Genisys' burger was supposed to include jalapeño aioli, roasted jalapeños, Pepper Jack cheese, bacon, tomatoes, romaine lettuce & avocado ... and it arrived sans bacon, lettuce, or tomato. I pointed this out to the server, and 5 minutes later, he arrived with a small plate with my missing bacon, lettuce, and tomato ... gee thanks. My wife's fish sandwich arrived frozen in the middle with the breading falling off, and her fries were cold. We sent it back, and it returned freshly microwaved to room temperature. Despite all these problems with both service & the food, no portion was comped except the birthday sandwich, nor was the server apologetic for this mediocre meal. Thanks to the Woodinville location, I strongly doubt I'll choose Red Robin over most fast food, especially the restaurants that put an emphasis on service over corporate banality. P.S. Yes, we did submit this feedback to   right after our visit, and got a response back 3 weeks later, saying my rewards account has been credited enough to earn me a free burger, though the free burger expired within 60 days of that email. I'm sorry to say that free burger has now expired, and my rewards account is now reset back to 0 ... oh darn.

We use to frequent RR once a week. My kids loved it. Recently so many changes have occurred. We get a "server" but really have to order through a computer. No personal service. 3 of 4 orders were wrong... My son's food were shorted and he noticed.  I wasn't a fan before but now my kids don't want to return... Blah blah blah.
Lousy service. Sat at the bar for 6 minutes before walking out. Not even an 'I'll be right with you'.

Sat at the bar...bartender acted too busy to go over anything (i have never eaten at this chain before). Ordered a basic burger and fries...burger was average,,,fries were defrosted to a decent temperature...service was marginal,,,tables dirty,,,wont be back

Recently went to this location as the others have been lacking well - this one is the same. We sat in the bar as it was a busy night and our server came immediately. He was training someone else so we assumed that he was good. Only the good train, right? Wrong. We gave him our order. We had to remind him of the milkshake, we never got an order of fries to start with and our food was wrong. We didnt point it out because to get all of this took over an hour. So we ate and left. He came to our table once after we got the food - his trainee was more helpful then him. Sorry Red Robin we will not be coming back to any locations.

First of all I have been to this location literally a hundred times. We always find it a fun and family friendly place... That is until tonight. We went to my friends daughters jr. High play and as a group of seven decided to grab a bite to eat after. We had four adults and three kids. We put our name in at the front and asked how long the wait was. We were told ten to fifteen min, okay no problem. We waited about ten min and then I asked the host if it would be faster if we separated into two different groups. He told me yes they could seat us faster that way and took us back to two open booths. The kids (13,12, and 7) at one table and the adults at another.   After waiting a few minutes the host then came back and informed us he was going to grab our drink order because our server was busy, we were more than okay with that.  He then returned about ten min later without our drinks and said our server was still too busy to see us so he was also going to take our food orders, okay still totally cool with us. At this point we had already been at the restaurant about 45min and we're getting hungry. We asked if the host could grab us some frys to tide us over till our food was ready, he said no prob... We finally got our drinks and then everyone disappeared. We spotted the host off in the back with his shirt untucked so I can only assume at that point he must have ended his shift. We were left with no frys, no food and no server... We waited for probably another fifteen minutes with no word from anyone when I decided to ask to speak with a manager.  At this point the manager came up and copped a huge attitude with me. When I told him we had no server he told me they were busy and should have just left our party in the waiting area... I took that as extremely rude and unnecessary especially because we were being very understanding and at no point ever demanded to be sat! He was defensive and very pissy. I have worked in a number of restaurants in my day and I can tell you that is not the kind of attitude I expect in a manager. Especially when I was not rude or demanding in the slightest bit.   After our conversation the manager brought some frys to our table and must have told a server to come see us because then she showed up. She was very nice and I feel bad saying anything at all because I am not one to normally complain but the way our party was handled was very crappy. I would say for our 150$ we should have just ordered a pizza and stayed home!  The quality of service at this restaurant has gone down hill!

What has happened to Red Robin? Second Red Robin in 2 months - they were both awful.  The food and food presentation has gone way downhill. Burger was cold - wrap had sad watered down BBQ sauce and nasty chicken and nothing else. Wilted lettuce in the Caesar.  What is up with the pay kiosk - do you not want to interact with your customers? The restaurant is remodeled with a chalk board instead of video games which is great - however you cannot write on the board with chalk it does not work very well????? The restaurant was remodeled yet they left the gross bathrooms.  What happened? Sad - but will not go again.

Food was great. Server not so much. The guy took our order for drinks, awesome. I got the margarita, my husband a beer and our friend a water. Got the beer and margarita in 5 min, the water took 25 min and 2 reminders, maybe they have a water shortage, I don't know. We ordered an appetizer, before the main of course. We got that after our burgers were served and we were half way through the meal. We had to ask twice for utensils and after waiting for 10 min for ketchup we just took it off another table. They were not rude, or disrespectful in any way. I'm giving 2 stars as they just didn't seem to want to pay attention. It's Christmas Eve I get it. We don't have family here and we wanted to go out. We were there for a good 90 min and we're just the sit down, order, shove face, and leave types. If the restaurant was super full I probably would have been OK with the brainless and mind slips that seemed to be happening, but there were like 5 tables seated. Seriously 5. . . There was a second server after the first, Ricky, he was pretty cool.

Super busy so we decided to sit in the bar.  Dirty tables, wrong order delivered, and a very angry server added up to a bad experience.  We kept trying to get our female server to calm down but she just wasn't having it.  The food was less than appetizing, the fries were barely cooked, we had a bacon lovers burger delivered with no bacon.  When we pointed it out, the server got angry at us.  Really?!?  Done with Red Robin...
Each time we go it gets slower and slower. Last time I got a Cesar wrap with extra dressing and it came with no dressing. Instead of getting it remade the guy just gave me a side of dressing. Weak.

Today, Sunday, we went to Red Robin Woodinville, WA.  Was myself, a baby in a high chair, my daughter, her hubs, my hubs.  We've been before, good big juicy burgers, great chocolate milkshakes, good service.  But, not today.  We had the SLOWEST waitress ever in my life. I felt alone and abandoned.  And, it was NOT even busy in there. Was 3:30 in the afternoon. Seahawks game over.  Only 2 or 3 tables occupied.  Usually, at a RR, they grab your drink and get a refill when you slurp your straw at the last drop in the bottom.  Before you even ASK.  Bam, new one! Not this chick. We waited ... and waited... and waited... I even waved my arms (and embarrassed my kids.)  Nope. Even the manager and other waiters in the building ignored us. Normally, when your own waitress is busy, you can catch the eye of a waiter that is not your waiter, and say "hey can we get a water?" Nope. No catching the eye of ANYONE in the building.   Burgers were great. Nom nom. (thanks to the cook!) Fries were COLD. We were so hungry we ate them anyway. We asked for fries ahead of the burgers to have something to chew on. Long wait. Cold fries. When Burgers finally came, they were fine.  Check 95 bucks for burgers! We could have done a lot better.  Will not be back.  Thankfully, the RR in Burlington is great!

I love Red Robin chain, but this particular Red Robin was not up to par with Red Robin standards. My burger was like a hockey puck! Both the regular and sweet potato fries were limp and greasy.  The only good thing we had was our onion ring appetizer.

I was in this evening 2/18/2016 at 9:10. I have never used Yelp to give a rating but the food was horrible. We did not want to say anything to our server because she was fantastic. Best service I have had in a few outings. Anyway I just want to say do not come in an hour before close at this location and expect good food. I would give our server a 5 star, the restaurant deserves a 0.

Loved our waitress she was super friendly. I think her name was Chelsea, She was the best and made it a really good time. Food was great we ordered the guacamole bacon burger it was delicious they barely served any fries though. Anyways over all service was great!

Meh.   Fast, kid friendly and reliable. Nothing great, and I would say nothing horrible until I went today.  Tried their new nachos and realized they forgot there are supposed to be toppings.  Their version of nachos is a plate of chips, lightly drizzled with cheese and chili and then burnt in the oven.  Every third chip had a tiny bit of toppings.  The rest were just boring and burnt.  Then the manager comes sweeping around and messes up the servers rhythm and then waddled off to screw up the hostess.  It was just bad nachos and manager inserting themselves when they should have just let the server and hostess work.   Overall avoid the nachos and everything else will be typical burger fare

I love how I get a free hamburger or chickenburger on my birthday every year from this fine establishment. :)  But I love them year 'round for lots of things. Love swapping out fries for freckled fruit salad (yummy and healthier). Love the milkshakes. But also all the lemonades, and other special restaurant made drinks. Bar has nice selection as well. ;) Some of the nicest and most helpful employees that will sub out bread, bring more sauces for anything and everything, will bring fry refills forever! Always clean restaurant and restrooms. All, in all a top notch establishment that I highly recommend.

Sat in the bar.  Friday night.  Felt so lucky to have snagged a table! Ordered a Prime Chophouse:  A fire-grilled burger layered with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, gourmet steak sauce, provolone, country Dijon and crispy onion straws on an onion bun.  Wow!  I wouldn't change a thing. Steak fries consistently good. Our server was attentive.   Considering it was a busy Friday night, she did a great job checking in with us.

I find it harder and harder to find a good red robin. Service was slow and we where ignored most of the time. Had to call a server for refills. You son liked the cluks and fries so they get a star for that I ordered the pick 2 sampler with cheese sticks and mushrooms. The cheese sticks where luke warm and the mushrooms where soggy. I also ordered the tavern fries. I can't say if they where bad or good as I never got them and had to have them removed from the bill. All told a very disappointing experience.

This red robin is right near my home so I go often and the service is always "ehh" the Togo always take 10 minutes longer than they say it will take and yet my food is always a little cold. It's like it was ready at the right time but sat there for 10 extra minutes.  When I have been dining in I have always had waiters and waitresses who seemed annoyed to be at work and never came back to check in. They always took our order, gave us our food and that was it.  The food when dining in is always good but the service kills me.
Wow, one of the best burgers I have had, period. Excellent customer service, poppin' atmosphere on a Friday night! Fun place to go with friends. Family dinner looked chill too!

I unfortunately received food poisoning from eating here. I had the bacon cheese burger and about two and a half hours later I was in the restroom vomiting. I would not reccomend eating here. I don't think they take food safety very seriously. I even saw a worker in the back pick up his drink with gloves on take a sip then put it down near him to continue working with people's food.

Went in to redeem an email offer. Was told I didn't order a 'gourmet burger' so the manager Rita wouldn't honor the offer. Claimed she had no way to do an adjustment in the register. Working in the service industry, I highly doubt this was true. The Then she proceeded to blame the poor waitress. A good manager should always back their staff up. Food was good but sadly tainted by the poor customer service.

Definitely my favorite Red Robin in the area. We tend to end up here around 8pm on weekdays and just roll into the bar. Tables are always clean, and the staff acknowledges you super quickly. Shoutout to Chris in the bar for being an awesome, attentive server and for being hilarious. They have Angry Orchard on draft, which is awesome because I can get a giant one to wash down my clucks and fries with (yup, still ordering the same thing since I was 12). Husband's margaritas were strong and still tasty. Our food came out quickly, was hot, and had a good amount of fries to go with. This pretty much covers everything you want/need out of a Red Robin. Love the checkout process is on the table, so we can roll out whenever we're done.

We love red robin, but this location sucks. The service was slow, forgot our fries, doubled our kid order, my clam chowder had sand in it and when my husband mentioned it the server said she didn't even know if they made it there. Not a good experience at all. Bummer..

This place is horrible. My wife and I used to take our family to Red Robin all the time.  They have cheapened EVERYTHING....even the kids meals. Upgrade to the onion rings.....for $1.49 and you get 5 rings.  Do the math on that one....and you don't get the fries. The front hostess really needs to google the definition of what that is. She really needs to go work at the DMV instead. Service is slow. No sight of a manager. This is not the first time either, but it will be the last. Whatever executive is running this chain into the ground needs a pink slip.

Terrible service. Terrible attitudes. Waited 15 minutes once seated and no one approached us. We finally flagged down the host and asked if we had a server. He said he didn't know but wait a bit longer. We finally gave up and left. Red Robin sure isn't what it used to be.

It was great to go to red robin and get great service and great food. I will be back to this location even though it's 25 minutes away and there are 3 or 4 closer ones. The waiter Alan was on it and that that made the experience great and the food taste even better. He got a ballon for my baby and regularly check in on us. Thanks for the lovely evening! We will be back!

I am not one to complain unless I feel very strongly about it, so this is a lot for me. I have never been to a Red Robin before and felt SO unwelcome. I came in a half hour after they opened to meet my grandma for her birthday lunch. Our waitress Kourtney blew us off the entire time, helping the only other table in the restaurant and speeding past our table. She didn't write down our order, which I dont mind, but my grandmas order was wrong and she didnt bring any of the extra things we asked for- dipping sauce, more fries, coffee refill, ect. We had to ask a different waiter, John, to help us since she wouldn't come to check in on us at all. The fries were cold, my salad was wack, wrong order for the bday girl, cold coffee. Plus I paid basically $10 for a tiny plate of lettuce (no croutons or cheese on my salad for some reason) and a cup of coffee. I just moved over to this area so I definitely will not be coming back- I'll have to continue going to the one by Alderwood where there is always hot food, great service, and smiles.

Parking is great.  food is okay but not great. Menu is extensive with options of hamburgers it gets a little overwhelming.  Bottomless fries is always awesome.  Price is great.  SERVICE SUCKS!!! Staff at this location is not the most helpful. You ask to sit in a certain empty booth and they say no. Its silly. If you are coming with a fussy baby you want to sit as far away from other guests so you don't disturb them.  Next visit again there is practically an empty restaurant but the hostess wants to seat us at the booth directly next to an occupied booth. Its like getting on an empty airplane and the flight attendant demanding you sit in the middle seat between 2 people when the rest of the plane is empty. Really where is the common sense. Management is not focusing on customer service here.  Another time the hostess did not greet us. We did not seat ourselves so we waited patiently not saying anything to see if she would acknowledge us. It got to the point it was a joke between my husband and a game to see how long she would ignore us and keep walking by before saying hello or realizing we wanted a seat. She saw us walk in. She looked up from her booth. She grabbed menus and arranged them in the stack. She walked past my husband and I 4 times as we stood in the lobby. It was not until she walked past us again to wipe down windows with windex that my husband finally spoke up. 14 minutes. She tried to seat us in the bar and we said we don't feel comfortable there we don't drink and she rolled her eyes as she led us to a table in the restaurant.  Only reason we did not leave was it was the only place still open with hamburgers after 9pm. And we were killing time before going to the movies.  Customer service is horrible but the food is fairly inexpensive and they are open late so that is the only reason why we go. We will consciously make an effort to never return and instead use that Hawaiian themed burger joint in town but they close at 9:30.

I know I already reviewed this place before... but... I feel I would be remiss if I did not share a certain-- *cough* shall we say-- "experience" I had there recently... It all started when I was trying to find a restaurant that was accommodating with regards to dairy allergies. Some places did alright, while other failed miserably. When I went to Red Robin, I was CERTAIN they would pass with flying colors... BOY was I in for a surprise... For my order, I asked for a Burnin' Love Burger with mayo on the side, and cucumber slices with the non-dairy breading used for the onion rings. The waiter confidently took my order... then, as he was walking away, I tugged on his sleeve. "By the way," I said nonchalantly as he turned to look at me, "I'll need you to file an allergy alert for dairy along with my order." (Should be simple enough), I thought to myself, scratching my chin. (After all, Red Robin's allergy alert system is ingenious. I've ordered burgers without cheese from them before, so why should this challenge be any different?) All that was left was to steeple my fingers and wait. The ball was in the Robin's court. Some time later, my meal arrived. As the waiter turned to leave, I tugged his sleeve again to stop him. "A test," I said, holding up my finger. He watched, frowning as I lifted the bun off the burger. So far, so good... I deftly flipped through the lettuce, jalapeno rings, tomatoes, and the patty... no cheese on either side of any of them. The mayo was in a little cup to the side, just as I had asked-- a perfect solution had I been allergic to eggs, and had I been accompanied by someone else who wanted extra mayo. I cracked my knuckles-- time to step it up a notch. The waiter began to speak, but I shushed him. I would NOT be distracted. Lifting a cucumber stick to my lips slowly, I ran it from side to side, tasting the breading carefully for any trace of dairy. "It's clean," I announced with a sigh of relief. "That is all, waiter. You may go." As he slowly turned to walk away, I grabbed his sleeve again. "Wait!" I said, grabbing the burger. "There's something I forgot!" "I examined its insides thoroughly for any sign of cheese, and found not a trace. However, what of the bun?" I slowly traced my fingertip across the top of the bun, and confirmed my suspicion, I slowly lifted the bun to my mouth and licked it carefully, gathering evidence of the restaurant's mistake. "Butter!" I shouted. "You put butter on the buns, thinking I wouldn't notice, thinking that my allergies would flare up sometime later, and that I would blame them on something else! Well, you won't get a fast one past me... not only did your little trap fail my test, but I'm not even allergic to dairy! CHECKMATE!" This rather disillusioning experience was dragged out a while longer, but I won't bore you with the details. Suffice it to say, avoid the Robin if you have a severe dairy allergy. They might have a handle on the basics of allergy alerts, but they're a far cry from going pro...

Got seated fairly quickly for a busy Sunday w/ my two year old daughter Gave my order, but ended up getting the wrong item - had tomatoes when I asked for none , different fries, and no campfire sauce when I asked for some . Waiter was perfectly nice about everything though.  I come home about 30 minutes later and have a massive stomach ache :-/ I hope this isn't food poisoning

We always go to this location with my bestie so everyone is getting the food they love.  Service is spotty though. Most times we get great service but there have been times our food has been wrong or forgotten.  The food is usually consistent and tasty. Bottomless fries are the best with tartar of course!  The bartenders make awesome drinks and I can't wait to get the peach fireball mojito! It's my absolute favorite!

Well the new ordering process was kinda cool with the ziosk but he still got the food wrong didn't ask how I wanted my buger no pink ect. Well see how it turns out in the end our server was kinda strange lol.

Sit at the bar and benefit from better service. I definitely sympathize with how hard it must be to find 12.50 per hour workers in Woodinville and Kirkland. Still, this location sucks in comparison to Tukwila.Usually, i find Woodinville to host the nicest retail employees on earth. Can not explain my 4 experiences here.

Wasn't impressed by the margaritas anymore. They don't make Their own mix anymore. They use the crappie finest call stuff. Also, went back to the table as I left my sunglasses and the waitress was filling out the survey and said to me...don't worry I fave us a 10! I then said well I wouldn't so let me have it.  I thought this was really unprofessional amd will be call corporate on Monday as the "stats" are bogus!

Came in at 5, only people in the lobby, TONS of empty booths in the restaurant, told us 5-10 minute wait.  We wait, they try to seat us in an area that is nothing but windows, which we objected to ("yeah, didn't come here to sweat my ass off and be blinded while eating"). They take us back to the lobby, past over 20 booths in the main area, to be told 5-10 more minutes.  Wife's entire plate, fries and chicken were cold. My chicken was undercooked.
Love this place.... servers/host always friendly...food is always delicious....great place to go and relax and enjoy some really good food.....  this location is the only RR we go to.!!

Poor experience.  Our son asked specifically for Red Robin for his birthday.  What a disappointment.  The lettuce wrapped burger simply had one ice berg leaf on the top and one on the bottom.  Looked really bad.  Second burger had a hair in it.  The waiter forgot our sweet potato fries.  Then later forgot to refill them.  Charged us for five burgers, so even with the comp'd burger (because of the hair) we were overcharged.  Had to wait over 15 minutes to get that straightened out. Oh yeah, and they forgot to sing happy birthday to my son!

I am actually in the restaurant as I write this. There was hair, a lot of hair, in my food and then once they replaced it they tried to charge me for the original food and the replacement both. I don't think paying double for added hair is what I was expecting.

This is one of the better Red Robin locations in my opinion. My party of three went there for lunch last week and our server Alan was excellent! He was personable and friendly, and also worked hard to make sure we were happy. He brought two rounds of fries to the table without us asking before our food came and after our food arrived, he still came by many times to fill up on water and fries. This is the best service I've ever gotten in any Red Robin location.

I've been in 4 times since this place was remodeled earlier in the year, and have been disappointed each time.  Service is just horrible; staff is slow to take your order and even slower to deliver. The menu is varied and sounds great, but it's cold by the time it arrives. I won't  go back, and suggest you find someplace better.
Good food Very classic America diner. Wonderfully friendly staff
Saw two crips they couldn't get out had to get my fatass up and help them why isn't there automatic doors!!!!!!?

Had a great experience here with my friend!  We came during dinner hour on a Thursday and sat in the bar area. When we asked for some a basket of fries to snack on before our food came.  They actually brought us out two individual little baskets for each of us, and with a good amount of fries!  The last few times I've been to a Red Robin, the fries never make it out before the meal &/or they only give you a handful. We both got burgers and they were delicious, our server was great, and the little screen payment method made it quick and easy!  We really enjoyed our time.

I went here for lunch with my friend for her birthday burger last week. Our server was friendly but forgot to refill my friends root beer float. We asked her many times. Why is it refillable for $5 but you only get one?  They did not sing to my friend for her birthday.  I had to wait 20 minutes to get a refill on my coke but by then we were leaving.  The food was great, I got the teriyaki chicken burger and it was so moist!  The main thing I'm upset about is what they didn't do. We shouldn't have to ask more than twice for a beverage refill.  And I thought this was just a one time thing but a month ago I came here with friends and we sat in the bar. My tennis shoes slid under the table with all the grease!! It sickened me to know I was eating in a food establishment that doesn't mop their floors!! The same thing happened, across the restaurant - I'm beyond disgusted and won't be returning. I should put in a complaint to the health department.

Crappy service  . Rude rude waitress. Couldn't wait to leave. Cheesesticks were undercooked. The waitress after trying to shove her breasts in my face, treated me and my wife like a problem. The gentalman that brought out our food and the one that maintained our drinks was nice as could be. But if I go back. I will make sure that I do not sit in this waitresses area. She ruined the whole experience

You know, I've been here a few times (well, maybe different locations), and I don't remember much of the food. However, I came for dinner on my husband's birthday with him and my one-year old daughter. It's a great place if you have kids cause it's so loud, you don't feel bad if your kid is screaming, LOL. The wait was about 15 minutes or so on Thursday evening.  My husband and I shared the chicken wings and a Big Tavern Burger. The chicken wings were decent sized (sometimes meat on wings is skimpy, but not here). The flavor was amazing. We got the buffalo sauce I believe and there were cheese crumbles as well. Very satisfying. The Big Tavern Burger sauce was so good! I was supposed to share it w/the hubby, uhhh, but I didn't LOL. Whoopsie! I mopped that right up. I don't like big fries, but they're good for my daughter and she seemed to enjoy them.  Service was great. Things came out quickly despite them being so busy. Our server was friendly, efficient and gave good suggestions. I would definitely return if the wait isn't too long. Great place for families :)

Food good, service bad.  My wife and I went in here for lunch on 4-15-17.  When I asked the server what beers they had on tap, he rudely blurted out about a dozen or so.  I almost wanted to slap the little smart-a$$.  So I ordered a Pabst only because I saw it in the menu.  When he came back towards the end of our meal and asked if we wanted more fries, my wife declined, but I said I wanted more.  We didn't see him again.  Paid at the table with no tip.  Just spoke to the manager, she said the servers have a list of what's on tap, which rankles me even more!

Went to this one for a special occasion - 8 of us in all.  It was busy and we didn't mind the 30 minute wait.  Orders were taken quickly and everything seemed great, but... Our orders arrived mostly.  The burgers and salads did anyway - anything fried didn't.  And our appetizers showed up after our entrees.  And then came the fries - when most were done or nearing done. The server blamed the kitchen - of course.   So here is my math to arrive at 3 (generous) stars today... 1 star for the expediter in the kitchen who needs to manage the kitchen to get out apps, then full entrees - in that order.  This is not new and the kitchen, servers and me expect it. 2 stars for the server who should have done less blaming and more managing the backward operation.  And if you're not gong to manage it, then expect to comp something or get a less-than-great tip.  Today, you got the latter - but then, you earned it and now you know how to earn a bigger tip (and more stars) next time. 4 stars for the food.  It's Red Robin and the food is just good. Cheers!

Had never been to this location. Came in on Thursday for dinner about 6pm. It was kind of busy so we had to wait about 10 minutes to get a booth.   Took some time for our server.  Ordered fish and chips with garlic fries and side of chipolte sauce for the wife and i got Royal Red Robin burger with regular fries. Still put off by fact the chain raised the wedge salad from 3 bucks to five so we decided to forgo it this time.   Seemed to take forever to get our food...over 30 mins.  People who were seated after us and ordered later git their food before we did. Food was ok but server forgot the chilpolte sauce for my wife......7 minutes later he brings it.  I had to ask for refill even though our server walked by several times and looked at our table. So he comes back with garlic fries for my wife after 10 minutes.....and says to me the regular fries are coning.  I had to wait 25 minutes for regular fries and server only brohht them after he wqlked by a 5th time and saw my angry look. WTF? If you have garlic fries why wouldn't you have regular fores that take less time to make?  The manager was walking around like a chicken with his head cut off. He saw me looking angry but didnt come over. Instead he calls the server to the drink station and talks to him.....shortly after my fries showed up but half the serving size my wife received. They were broken pieces and hard....like what was left over but given to put something in front of me so as not to complain.  Wife wanted to get another refill as did I, but I didn't want to wait anotjer 25 minutes  Quality of food makes a rating of 2 otherwise service would have only gotten 1.
Continues to go downhill. Gave them a try after a year and we were reminded why we stopped eating here. So sad.

Eh. So-so. I've visited 4 or 5 different Red Robin's and this was my least favorite. Interior isn't kept up. Our chairs had holes in the upholstery and were pretty uncomfortable. We were seated at a table with too few chairs for members in our party, and we had to fetch chairs on our own. Our table was *way* too small for the 7 of us, and there were a lot of empty tables to spare. We were sat with 3 menus to share among 7 of us. We had to wait at least 10 minutes for a server to show up, just to place a drink order. The restaurant wasn't very busy, so these are all odd things to happen in a lull. Our server was peppy and quick with drink refills once we got going. We had some dirty silverware at the table, and we had to track someone down to get a spoon. My food was VERY so-so. It looked okay, but the fries were served cold and the bread on my sandwich was really hard. Nobody was super impressed.  Will not return.

First impression  is everything.  On my entrance  I was not greeted. There were also other people standing  around basically  waiting  for some one to say hi and find some seats for them.    I chose the bar. Little did I know this would make up 10 fold for the distasteful  1st impression. The staff was fast and respectful. The young lady serving my table was fast on the drink refills  and very on point when it came for check out.    The food was nothing  extraordinary  it was what you expect  from red robin. It was good and filling. Price is a bit high for what you get but not a deal breaker. The quality  I like the most here was the service.  Hands down good.  Would I recommend  eating  here? Yes. If your looking for a good place to have a party or just to come get some lunch  it's good.

My family and I have eaten here before and everything is pretty good. A few weeks ago, I was here with my boyfriend and little brother. We're around our 20's and my brother is about 14. While we were eating outside the waiter brought our food out. Unfortunately he spilled a cup of sauce all over my brother and I but I would just like to say he was extremely apologetic! I don't fault him whatsoever, it was an accident and we all understand it happens! The thing that upset me was when he came out with napkins, the manager followed him out. While he helped us clean up, she stood far back just watching the entire thing. When the waiter left and I turned around to look at her, she immediately went to the table behind us and asked how they were doing. She did not once come over to our table to see if everything was okay after that, and pretty much wrote us off. Just because we're younger and didn't freak out on the waiter, doesn't mean you shouldn't check in on us. It was rude to be ignored and to check on the table behind us instead! Female, blond manager if that helps narrow it down. Of course I never got her name since she never even came up to us...

We have been coming to this location for 6 years. It has always been hit or miss. You either get a 5* experience or a 1* experience, hence the 3* rating.
