I think the food is ok, but my kids love this place and will both sit there with perfect behavior and eat every bite so I will keep coming back. Tonight, they "ran out of ice" which is why we couldn't get drink refills...this was resolved at the end of our meal but everyone was quite thirsty given the salty food and 80+ degree temp. If you plan to frequent RR you should sign up for the loyalty program, it is something like buy 10 burgers get 1 free. With the typical wait to be seated, I finally read their sign with the origin story and had no idea RR was founded in Seattle in the U dist originally as Sam's Red Robin (named after some college quartet), which I thought was interesting.

Was told 15min for takeout... 35 min later with just an excuse that the kitchen got busy. Not a Way to run a business. If they told me an hour wait time I would have been fine with that. Don't say one time and have it be much longer after I'm already at the restaurant waiting for my food

11/5.  New Update... After watching three other tables get served food that were seated after us AFTER we placed our order, WE WALKED OUT.    I won't be back.    Update:   Better service, probably due to a very attentive bartender.  Food was just "okay" again, with fries being undercooked.     I had stopped going to Red Robin for a months because of poor overall experience at many locations, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOUTH CENTER (awesome through and through).   Not sure why, but the new lie seems to be the norm.    I did receive a request from customer service on my last review here requesting my contact info to "discuss my experience" but never heard back.  I guess I'll just write off all the locations except South Center, and treat Red Robin as a single location restaurant.   Oh well

Not a great experience last night at the Woodinville Red Robin.  We arrived and went into the bar.  It was busy but there were a few open seats here and there.  We didn't order anything elaborate or crazy.  2 waters,  a cup of french onion soup and a BLTA Croissant.  Not sure what happened but the three different parties that came in after us all got served their food before us.  We had ordered at about 612 pm and decided to leave 35 minutes later after the 3rd party got their food delivered and we still didn't have ours. Our water got refilled but never saw our food.   I think the bartender meant well,  especially when he dropped off a basket of fries to the 2nd party who arrived and ordered after us. He dropped the basket and said something to the effect,  "Here's some  fries while you wait for your order."  Oh, I almost forgot...  the couple who sat there prior to this 2nd couple had to point out to the bartender that we were waiting to be acknowledged  and wanted to order.  The bartender cane over and took our order. That couple left, the table got cleaned and the 2nd party came in and sat down.   It appears our order got lost and the bartender didn't even realize it because there was never any apology, obligatory basket of fries or explanation as to why it was taking so long. I don't mind the wait if it's busy and we all are waiting,  but when the 3rd party after us gets their food before us there is clearly an issue.  Oh, and the BLTA I ordered was given to one of the other three parties. Bummer.

I've been here three times in the last 6 months at different times of the day and each time it is at least a 20 minute wait to be seated.  I would understand if the dining area is full but each time it's only half full.  I think this Woodinville location needs to hire more people.  Also I would rather sit at a table and wait longer for service than stand in an small overcrowded waiting room.  This long wait has irritated me and given me enough time to write this review.  I suggest going to other locations.

Just as you would expect from a Red Robin. We didn't have to wait long at all and the staff was very nice. The Bacon Guacamole Burger was very good and as expected. My sons loved their milkshakes too. The beer was cold and fast. Overall nice time. PS - I really like the screens they have on the table to pay. Super easy

Tonight I took my kids to the Red Robin in Woodinville.  We frequent other Red Robin restaurants.  My son is a lover of fries and most of the time it's a challenge to get even two baskets during a meal. The Woodinville Red Robin has been consistently good at keeping him topped off with fries.  While the burgers are pretty great, I typically order the grilled chicken salad.  The chicken is always tender and everything is fresh.
